RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1M 70Y Turf CR: 82. Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if fo r $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it w ill be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FILLMORE EAST was allowed to settle down the backstretch then made a three wide bid on the final turn and split horses in mid stretch to run down the leader to prevail. COMPLETE raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a four wide bid on the final turn for a late rally and just missed. KLAYTON'S KANDY went to the front to a clear lead, edged away on the final turn but was tiring in the stretch and was caught in the final yards. WITH THIS VOW prompted the pace to the top of the stretch and was outfinished. DRIVEN BY SPEED was unhurried around the first turn then steadily advanced through the final turn and made a mid track rally. BLIND SIGHT raced near the back and was not a factor, passed tiring rivals in the stretch. FLOATING BY raced near the back and was not a threat, passed tiring rivals in the stretch. GIRL'S ON FIRE was forwardly placed through the final turn and gave way. MINDING MILLIE saved ground to no avail. BECKON was in tight and had to steady early going into the first turn then was allowed to settle in the middle of the pack to the final turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Minding Millie
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Fillmore East
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3w2nd turn, split horses, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Complete
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 4w2nd turn, late rally, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Beckon
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight, allowed to settle, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Driven by Speed
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, steady advance, mid track rally

ENTRY.NAME: Klayton's Kandy
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, edged away, tiring, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Blind Sight
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, no factor, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Floating By
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, no threat, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Girl's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: With This Vow
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M 70Y Turf CR: 70. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed in advisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile Seventy Yards.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORMY FIRE was placed off the pace from the inside through the final turn then angled out to the two path to make a late rally and was up in the final jumps. TWIST OF FAITH went to the front to an unchallenged lead to set all the pace but was nailed in the final jumps. ICANDOTHAT was unhurried around the first turn then steadily advanced down the backstretch, moved out to four wide in upper stretch to make a late run to be up for the show. FACTUM LOVE STYLE raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch, saved ground around the final turn and tipped out to three wide in upper stretch veered out in mid stretch and impeded outside foe, kept on and missed the show. TERRIBLEIGH prompted the pace through the final turn but lacked the late response. CERTAIN JUSTICE was rank around the first turn while lugging out then rushed up to be off the pace down the backstretch and was making a late run in the stretch but was pinched back in mid stretch and lost action. HENDERSON saved ground while being forwardly placed, moved between horses on the backstretch but tired in the stretch. FIFTH ELEMENT was rushed up to contention around the first turn from four wide but was through after a half. MARY'S LITTLE MAN raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then dropped back. HE'S SO FUNNY was bumped and forced out going into the first turn then lost action. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF CERTAIN JUSTICE CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF FACTUM LOVE STYLE FOR INTERFERENCE IN MID STRETCH, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS ALLOWED AND FACTUM LOVE STYLE WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM FOURTH TO SIXTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Henderson
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, forwardly, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Icandothat
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, steady advance, 4wupper, late run

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside, 2wupper, late rally, just up

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Gabriel Rispo, Barbara A. Rickline & Ryan L. Johnson

ENTRY.NAME: Fifth Element
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to contention, through after 1/2

ENTRY.NAME: Terribleigh
ENTRY.OWNER: Green Bottle Racing Stable and Nickol Roger A
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Factum Love Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, saved ground 2nd, 3wupper, impeded foe

ENTRY.NAME: Certain Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank, lugged out 1st, rush up, off pace, pinched stretch

ENTRY.NAME: He's So Funny
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out 1st, lost action

ENTRY.NAME: Mary's Little Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Twist of Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: unchallenged lead, set pace, nailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 79. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the ma in track at One Mileand One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRAZY KATER raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a rail bid on the final turn, angled out to two wide in upper stretch and ran down the leader to prevail. KASIM rushed to a clear lead to set all the pace but was caught late and fought gamely late. SAMARONTI raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then saved ground around the final turn, moved out to three wide in upper stretch and was gaining late. MINE TO HOLD chased the leader through the final turn but had no response at the top of the stretch and weakened. AMERICAN NIGHTMARE tracked the leader from off the rail down the backstretch, made a three wide bid on the final turn but gave way in the stretch. PRATT raced near the back and was not a factor. PURPLE SHIRT was unhurried down the backstretch and passed tiring rivals in the stretch. JO JO KATZ raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then dropped back. PANADERO was allowed to settle around the first turn then moved up from three or four wide down the backstretch, moved out to four wide in upper stretch but failed to sustain the bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Panadero
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, moved up 3-4w, 4wupper, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Crazy Kater
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, rail bid, 2wupper, ran down leader, prevail

ENTRY.NAME: American Nightmare
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, off rail, 3w2nd, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Purple Shirt
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Kasim
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead, caught late, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Mine to Hold
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, no response, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Pratt
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Jo Jo Katz
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Samaronti
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, saved ground 2nd, 3wupper, late gain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 1 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race S ince July 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SANTO stalked the pace down the backstretch then moved between horses at the seven sixteenths pole and engaged the leader at the quarter pole to take the lead at the three sixteenths pole and held off late outside closer. A T M AWESOME was off the pace through the final turn then moved out to three wide in upper stretch and ran down the leader but just missed. HOLD THE IRISH raced near the back down the backstretch then moved up around the turn and went between horses at the quarter pole to make a late rally, just up for the show. ARISTOCAT rushed to the lead going into the first turn then edged away on the backstretch but was headed at the quarter pole and had no late kick, faded. LAST MINUTE MARIO pressed the pace around the first turn then tracked the leaders down the backstretch and gave way. KRACHENWAGEN was forwardly placed from three or four wide to the three furlong marker then retreated. VISHNU was restless in the gate, saved ground to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Vishnu
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate, saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Last Minute Mario
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, tracked leaders, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Aristocat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, headed 1/4, no kick, faded

ENTRY.NAME: A T M Awesome
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, ran down leader, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Hold the Irish
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, bid turn, between 1/4, rallied, up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Santo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, between 7/16, engaged 1/4, led 3/16, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Krachenwagen
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly place, 3-4w, retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since August 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRAZY LEGS HIRSCH raced between horse in the second flight from off the pace, moved out to four wide in upper stretch, engaged the leader in the final sixteenth and inched away to prevail. HORN OF PLENTY went to the front to take a pressured lead and was eclipsed at the eighth pole but fought gamely to the wire. ALLABOUTTHEMONEY raced from three wide in the second flight from off the pace, moved out to five wide in upper stretch and engaged the leader at the eighth pole but drifted in nearing the sixteenth pole and had to steady late. EAGLES CRY raced on the inside in the second flight from off the pace, slipped through entering the stretch and engaged the leader at the eighth pole but was outfinished. MEET ME AT MUNDIS chased the leader through the turn and passed tired one. YES IT'S ROO pressed the pace from the two path to the three sixteenth pole and gave way. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF ALLABOUTTHEMONEY CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF CRAZY LEGS HIRSCH FOR ALLEGED INTERFERNCE IN DEEP STRETCH, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Meet Me At Mundis
ENTRY.OWNER: Siedler Craig and Simoff Andrew L
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, passed tired one

ENTRY.NAME: Eagles Cry
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins 2nd flight, off pace, slip thru, engaged leader, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Crazy Legs Hirsch
ENTRY.COMMENT: between 2nd flight, off pace, 4wupper, led 1/16, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Horn of Plenty
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured lead, eclipsed 1/8, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Yes It's Roo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Allaboutthemoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w2nd flight, off pace, 5wupper, drifted in, steadied late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 1. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARGING LION was off the pace on the inside through the turn then tipped out to three wide in upper stretch and cruised home. ECLIPTICALS ELLIOT was hustled to a clear lead through the turn but was headed at the eighth pole and fought gamely, outfinished. COAST TO COAST was off the pace from the two path then moved up around the turn to engage the leader at the top of the stretch but couldn't catch and was outkicked. JETTIN OUT chased the leaders through the turn then moved out to four wide in upper stretch to make a mild gain but weakened. E T'S SUPER STAR raced near the back through the turn while saving ground, angled out to five wide in upper stretch but was not a threat. ROCKET BLAST trailed the field and was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: E T's Super Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, saved ground, 5wupper, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Charging Lion
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside, 3wupper, cruised home

ENTRY.NAME: Eclipticals Elliot
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, headed 1/8, fought gamely, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Coast to Coast
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, bid turn, engaged, gamely, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Rocket Blast
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Jettin Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, 4wupper, mild gain, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 21500. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NORTHWOODS was off the pace down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the five sixteenths pole, drove past the leader in mid stretch and drew clear. BANJO pressed the pace from the inside to the quarter pole then took a brief lead but was caught at the eighth pole but proved second best. PRALINESALLSHOOKUP chased the leaders down the backstretch then made up ground from the inside around the turn and kept on to be along for the show. RAY OF LIGHT showed no speed and passed tiring rivals. Z MYSTIQUE was hard to load into the gate, shot away from the gate to show good speed to the quarter pole and tired. ICY COLD was forwardly placed from three wide to the seven sixteenths pole and dropped back.

ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3wturn, drove past, drew clear,

ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leaders, rail bid, along show

ENTRY.NAME: Banjo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, inside, brief lead, second best,

ENTRY.COMMENT: hard to load, good speed, tired
